intro: Hedyotis macrostemon, commonly known as the large-stemmed dotweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hedyotis macrostemon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
